title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to help users visualize and manage their accumulated sleep debt. This tool allows users to track their sleep patterns, calculate the difference between their target and actual sleep hours, and understand the impact of sleep debt on their overall well-being. The project aims to provide a simple and intuitive interface for promoting healthier sleep habits and serves as a practical application of TypeScript development.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the TeX source code for my resume, along with an HTML version generated from it. It serves as a personal project demonstrating proficiency in creating and managing a professional resume using both TeX for precise formatting and HTML for web accessibility. The project showcases skills in typesetting, web development, and version control, and acts as a living document updated with my latest experiences and accomplishments.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a personal project built with Next.js 14, TypeScript, and Material UI, showcasing a clean and organized dashboard interface using the pages router. It leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and management, offering a modern development environment for exploring best practices in building performant and well-structured React applications.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a project exploring decentralized voting systems, built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. This repository contains the code for a voting application focusing on secure and transparent vote casting and tabulation, leveraging modern web development practices to provide a user-friendly and efficient experience.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project leveraging HTML and Python to create interactive and insightful map visualizations. This repository explores techniques for displaying geographical data on maps, focusing on practical application and data representation. It serves as a demonstration and learning resource for anyone interested in geospatial data visualization using web technologies.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a full-stack CRUD application built with Python, Flask, PostgreSQL, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, designed as a project to demonstrate proficiency in building dynamic web applications. This repository showcases the implementation of Create, Read, Update, and Delete functionalities while incorporating database interaction, front-end design, and server-side logic, providing a hands-on example of a complete web development project using a Python-based tech stack.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript-based project showcasing a fully interactive and customizable event calendar built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. This repository provides a foundational framework for creating dynamic event calendars, allowing users to easily add, edit, and manage events with a visually appealing interface.  It serves as a practical example for learning front-end web development and event management concepts.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: iot-asset-tracking is a web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS, leveraging Supabase for backend services, to track and manage IoT assets. This project aims to provide a user-friendly interface for monitoring asset location, status, and other relevant data, demonstrating modern web development practices and integration with cloud-based data management solutions.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next Idea Board is a collaborative project management tool built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to facilitate brainstorming and organization of ideas. Inspired by Kanban boards, it allows users to create, manage, and prioritize tasks within a visually intuitive interface. This project showcases modern web development practices and aims to provide a flexible and user-friendly platform for project collaboration.

title: atg-world
description: ATG-World is a project built using TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. It is a web-based application focused on [Insert the main purpose of the project, e.g., visualizing geographical data, simulating a world environment, providing a platform for global collaboration etc. - Use the README to understand the project's aim]. The repository showcases the implementation of modern web development techniques and principles.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built using Jupyter Notebook and Python, provides practical examples and projects for applying Python to finance. It explores various financial concepts and demonstrates how to leverage Python for data analysis, modeling, and visualization in areas such as investment analysis, portfolio management, and risk assessment. The project aims to equip users with the skills to effectively use Python for financial problem-solving.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern web application dashboard built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. This repository demonstrates best practices in front-end development, offering a functional and visually appealing dashboard interface useful as a template or starting point for various web application projects. It focuses on efficient component architecture, type safety, and responsive design principles.

This repository contains the code for [mention a key aspect of the project, e.g., the frontend application, the backend API, or the core logic].

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository houses a web-based interface for visualizing and interacting with data from the Robofleet robotics platform. Built using JavaScript, Python (likely for backend API or data processing), HTML, and CSS, this project aims to provide a user-friendly dashboard to monitor robot status, sensor readings, and other relevant information, falling under the general "project" topic category. It allows for real-time insights and control of Robofleet-connected robots.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripts, it provides a user-friendly interface to parse, filter, and display ROS log data, making it easier to debug and understand robot behavior. This project aims to simplify ROS log analysis through an intuitive and interactive dashboard.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a web application built with TypeScript, Vite.js, and Express.js that leverages the Gemini API to provide interactive and engaging conversations. This project explores the integration of large language models into a modern web framework, showcasing best practices for TypeScript development, API integration, and building a dynamic user interface with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-seller is a full-stack e-commerce web application built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and React, showcasing a robust and type-safe approach to building online stores. It leverages MUI for a polished user interface, React Query for efficient data fetching and caching, and TypeScript to ensure code quality and maintainability, demonstrating best practices for modern web development projects focused on e-commerce.
